intro: Chusua secunda, commonly known as the narrowleaf chusua, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Chusua secunda is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
